results.name: Sum of digits of (n written in base 9).
comment: a(n) = A138530(n,9) for n > 8. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 26 2008
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..59049
Robert Walker, Self Similar Sloth Canon Number Sequences
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digit Sum
example: a(20) = 2+2 = 4 because 20 is written as 22 base 9.
It appears that this can be written as a triangle (see the conjecture in the entry A000120):
where the rows converge to A173529. (End)
mathematica: Nest[ Flatten[ #1 /. a_Integer -> Table[a + i, {i, 0, 8}]] &, {0}, 3] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 27 2006 *)
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 28 2000
